current-chamber.#text: IN THE SENATE OF THE UNITED STATES

official-title.#text:
To clarify the disposition of covered persons detained in
		  the United States pursuant to the Authorization for Use of Military Force, and
		  for other purposes.

sponsor.#tail: introduced the following bill; which was read twice and referred to the

short-title.#text:
Due Process and Military Detention
			 Amendments Act of 2013

text.#text: This Act may be cited as the

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text:
Section
			 1021 of the National Defense Authorization Act for Fiscal Year 2012
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: National Defense Authorization Act for Fiscal Year 2012/s:1021

header.#text:
Disposition of covered
			 persons detained in the United States pursuant to the Authorization for Use of
			 Military Force

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: National Defense Authorization Act for Fiscal Year 2012/s:1021/ss:c
National Defense Authorization Act for Fiscal Year 2012/s:1021/ss:g

text.#text:
by adding at the
			 end the following new subsections:

header.#text:
Disposition of
				covered persons detained in the United States

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
, disposition under the law of war shall occur immediately upon the person
				coming into custody of the United States Government and shall only mean the
				immediate transfer of the person for trial and proceedings with all the due
				process rights as provided for under the Constitution of the United
				States.
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text:
Authorization for Use of Military
				Force
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Authorization for Use of Military Force

text.#text:
In the case of a covered person who is detained in the
				United States pursuant to this Act or the

header.#text:
Persons
				detained pursuant to this Act or the Authorization for Use of Military
				Force

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text: Authorization for Use of Military Force
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Authorization for Use of Military Force

text.#text:
No person detained, captured, or
				arrested in the United States, or a territory or possession of the United
				States, may be transferred to the custody of the Armed Forces for detention
				under this Act or the

header.#text:
Prohibition on
				transfer to military custody

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text:
Authorization for Use of Military
				Force
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Authorization for Use of Military Force

text.#text:
This section shall not be construed to authorize the
				detention of a person within the United States, or a territory or possession of
				the United States, under this Act or the

header.#text:
Repeal of
			 requirement for military custody

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text:
Section
			 1022 of the National Defense Authorization Act for Fiscal Year 2012
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: National Defense Authorization Act for Fiscal Year 2012/s:1022
National Defense Authorization Act for Fiscal Year 2012/s:1029/ss:b

{http://purl.org/dc/elements/1.1/}title.#text: 113 S1147 IS: Due Process and Military Detention Amendments Act of 2013
